website_summaries.verdict: A long, versatile roof snow rake that helps prevent snow build-up.
pros: Compact and collapses into three pieces for convenient storage
cons: Plastic wheels sometimes don't roll properly or fall off

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product with one flaw
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product with one flaw . . . . The wheels! They came off within the first hour that I used the rake. The design for the wheels is very poor. I made replacement wheels (see photo) which added a little weight, not much, and really worked better. They are metal Garage Door Rollers strapped to the rake with screw clamps. The other flaw is the extension handle connections which are hard to separate to put the rake away, the only solutions to this that I can see would add too much weight.
customer_reviews.author: PB in WA

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product with one tip
customer_reviews.text: Its fairly light weight and sturdy, I have a suggestion or a tip. When you are using this rake at full length, after a while , it becomes difficult to maneuver it. What I started to do was to place the rake handle on my shoulder and then started to walk steps backwards and forwards with my hands firm on the handle. This gave my arms and shoulders enough rest to start again. Else my arms, hands and shoulders were getting very tired with the continuous movement.
customer_reviews.author: F. Khan

customer_reviews.title: but I'm disappointed with the (wheels
customer_reviews.text: The overall construction is ok, but I'm disappointed with the (wheels ?) /rollers. The roller has a slit in it meant to slide over the bottom edge of the rake and into a cutout area of the body. After sliding on, the roller is meant to turn. One of mine turns, the other doesn't its jammed. Either the hole in the roller is too small or the metal between the cutout and the edge of the rake is too large. When I use the rake this wheel constantly falls off, and I'm sure at some point it'll be lost in the snow 'till spring. Not happy.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useful Tool
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is supposed to do. A good tool if you need to clear snow from a roof. It is hard work if the snow is deep or heavy but it does work. Very awkward if all extensions are used, we found that it worked better if we left one extension pole off. We lose some reach but it was hard to use with all the extensions connected. Other than that, it pulled the snow off the roof. It will fill the gutters with snow but that cannot be prevented since you are pulling the snow across the gutters (unless you somehow cover them).
customer_reviews.author: Lauren K.

customer_reviews.title: Came with half the parts needed - not usable
customer_reviews.text: It came with some of the parts - which is why I’m giving 1 star. Not really usable without the connecting bolts or blade connectors - so I can’t comment on whether this works or not. Entire contents recieved shown in picture attached. I really needed to use it today to remove ice damming on the house - looks like that’s not happening - thanks Garelick
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Item was received with part which was stamped incorrectly so I could not assemble. Referred to customer service for replacement part. Asked for several item, models, serial numbers etc which were not on the box. Was told I needed to find the sticker - honestly it isn’t there. Then told I needed to register the product and then receipt needed.... Returning the piece of junk as I spent 45 minutes on the phone to not get a proper part. Customer service is the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Very poor wheel design
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, nice and lightweight. Major flaw with the rollers though, as you can see in the pictures. For whatever reason, the roller spaces are cut too narrow for the wheel to actually rotate when against a surface. They look fine while no pressure is against them and as soon as you out it against a surface the 'tread' groove in the wheel grabs theetal and won't rotate. So now I'm left with the option of disassembling and returning or disassembling and enlarging that space for the unit to properly function. As for the snow clearing ability, I can speak to that yet though I'm not sure this is the device for the job.
customer_reviews.author: J Beman

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: It did the exact job it was supposed to do - what I mean is, since I purchased it, it hasn't snowed once. Kinda like buying a snow blower after a big storm. It's everyone's luck that the next time it snows like that, the damn thing won't start because it's been 5 years and the new model has way cooler features. Very happy with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Timpson

customer_reviews.title: Better instructions would have helped.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I each bought these snow rakes. In assembling them, we diligently followed the directions. However, the rakes both fell apart within a few minutes of using them. I called the company and learned from them that in addition to the written directions, you must use a tool (pliers or wrench) to hold the nut while using a screwdriver to tighten the screws. They agreed to send me more screws and nuts free of charge. Armed with the replacement parts and the proper tools, the rake was reassembled. It then worked very well. Would have been nice to have the proper instructions included with the rakes for those of us without proper experience in these matters!
customer_reviews.author: jab

customer_reviews.title: Works harder than I wanted to.
customer_reviews.text: I only used it once so far but I used it enough. First I live in the Upper Michigan. We get more than a fair share of snow. This take is pretty sturdy but feels a little flimsy with all the extensions. I removed several feet of heavy snow (little at a time) off 2 parts of my house. This rake did an excellent job (so did I if I say so myself). As I. Other reviews that I saw the handles can be tough to get apart, other than that no complaints other than I bent it slightly but that is my own fault.
customer_reviews.author: G. Vallier

customer_reviews.title: Easy to recommend this snow rake!
customer_reviews.text: A very good product. There is plenty of handle length. I have 12 foot walls on my building with a 12/12 pitch roof. I used only 3 of the 4 handle sections. The product is light weight and easy to handle. At the same time, it is strong enough to hold up and get the job done. It is all made of aluminum so wear work gloves as they will get dirty. I was able to remove a lot of snow in a very short time. This product was also very easy to assemble. We live in north Idaho and receive plenty of snow. I can easily recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to put together and use
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together and use, separating the different sections made it easy to use for different locations. It is light weight....it has to be for the job it does. I was cutting through ice crusted wet snow and it was a work out this product worked amazing. I did break off both wheels...slamming it down to break the 2 inch ice layer beneath the snow to break it up into chunks (so not the intended purpose of this tool).. I am happy to say I used and abused it. Do not expect to clear a 21 foot path each time to scrape away at the snow...you have to chip away at it.
customer_reviews.author: gitrdone

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy: Broke on the first use
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time after reading the instructions on how to properly assemble, how to properly use, and assembling it. The two bolts that hold the supporting arms to the rake head fell off practically immediately and were lost in the snow. I purchased this product based on the reviews and that fact that it was made in the USA, but I guess quality has dropped off. Pros: -Simple instructions -Fast shipping Cons: -Fell apart on first use -Plastic "wheels" don't roll, effectively useless
customer_reviews.author: Etienne

customer_reviews.title: The wheels don't work.
customer_reviews.text: For the silliest reason, the wheels can never work. Somebody cut the rectangular hole in the rake where the wheels are mounted way too narrow, blocking any movement of the wheels. I'm going to return the unit and order another one to see if they get it right the 2nd time. If not then I will use tin snips to cut the hole to size. I shouldn't have to do that without billing Garelick for my time.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M.

customer_reviews.title: flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in the quality of this product. There a several poles that lock together with a pin. The longer you make the pole, the less stable it becomes. At max length, you'll have one very flimsy rake to try and handle. I also found this did not "roll" down the roof too well. Instead, the blade basically drags. Finally, mine had no assembly instructions. You can figure things out pretty well from a picture of the rake, but all assembly-required products like this should have instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Fat Guy in a Little Coat

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Minnesota and this past February we had the most snow ever for the month at 39 inches. I was able to get this delivered early in the month and can say that it worked great. We did not have any icicles build up from areas where I raked, assembly was easy, the adjustable reach of the rake allows me to hit my roofs different angles. We have a 4-level split home and two different roofs. I would have given this a 5 if connecting the different pole lengths didn’t get stuck now and than. It was unbearable. It just took like 2 minutes of jiggling it around
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: It works well!
customer_reviews.text: Had over 2 feet of snow on roof. This took care of it. Dob't be fooled, it is hard work no matter how you get the snow off your roof. Standing on the ground with two extensions works but if you go to 3 extensions it gets too heavy so I used an extension ladder against the house and mostly used 2 extensions. It's best to get the snow right away after a storm. Don't let it pile up. The only thing I added to this rake is tape so I could get a better grip. Cold and snow on the aluminum handle is slippery. I'd recommend this rake. It's lite.
customer_reviews.author: Guzman

customer_reviews.title: This works only for freshly fallen snow
customer_reviews.text: The scraping end will pull new snow off the roof but if the snow has had time to harden, forget it. You need the long handle to reach the roof but from 20 feet away, it is not possible to get the plow end to dig into harder snow to grab it and pull it off. If you don't clear your roof off immediately, you'll be up there with a shovel as this device is quickly unusable. There is no misrepresentation here, I'm just saying it is probably not worth spending money on.
customer_reviews.author: JayMK

customer_reviews.title: You tink it's good? You betcha.
customer_reviews.text: It's funny that these are made in Minnesota, and I live in Minnesota - but because I waited too long to order one, they shipped it to me from California. This one went full circle. Anyway, it works great. If I had any complaint, it's that the aluminum tubes are difficult to grasp so you almost have to have the handle part at the end to get any grip. That wouldn't be a problem, but those extensions are also pretty hard to remove - especially while wearing gloves. That's all nit picky though. It worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Vader

customer_reviews.title: Really needed this rake for the snow this winter
customer_reviews.text: I never had a snow rake before, but this year demanded we get one. This one extends out for over 20 feet, and while at that length it's a bit awkward, it does a good job on the snow. Most of what I needed to rake required less length so I used only part of the handle as you only need to install as many handle extenders as necessary. It worked well and efficiently, and was light enough that I felt comfortable using it for an extended period.
customer_reviews.author: C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: This rake is very poor quality. The rollers DO NO ROLL SMOOTHLY due to the design of the wheel. Thus when pulling snow off the roof, they get stuck and actually drag on the roof causing more damage to shingles than if they weren't on the rake at all. I assembled the "head" of the rake, inserted the buttons into each section of pole (4), went to insert the first pole into the pole connected to the head, and the pole section in the head had NO HOLE FOR THE BUTTON TO FIT INTO! Poor quality control. THEN I HAD TO DISASSEMBLE the entire rake to return it. Don't waste your time or money on this rake. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job of removing snow from the roof
customer_reviews.text: Being new to living in Maine, getting a roof rake sounded ridiculous. Expecting 2ft of snow next week it didn’t sound so ridiculous any more. Pros: + extremely easy to put together + it’s got nice length + does a great job of pulling snow and ice off the roof + the instructions are easy to follow and the tips of using hot water to get the grip and wheels on were spot on Cons - it does take a little getting used to handling it - not sure the wheels really work, but they do seem to help
customer_reviews.author: Todd Yolish

customer_reviews.title: It is lightweight and does the job
customer_reviews.text: I live in "Ski Country USA" Colorado where we can have 400 plus inches of snow a winter. I use this to clear my roof and my horse and utility trailers and what with the addition of the small wheels on the edge of the rake, I have yet to gouge or damage any of the surfaces of all three. Couldn't get through a winter without it! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Lee Gamble

customer_reviews.title: This Product is Not Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I used this for 2+ hours and it broke multiple times. The screws are terrible and loose and this product cannot handle real snow. I used a neighbors similar product for the same amount of time and it was 10X better. I would not suggest this for anyone who gets more than 6 inches of snow at a time. It is poorly assembled and at full length, bends way too much and then if you pull on the product much at all, it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S Smith

customer_reviews.title: Missing components on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Bought this rake this spring but I ended up not using it right away. I put the unopened box away for the summer. Now we’ve just received our first major snow this winter and I grab it thinking I might get some snow off my roof. As I go to assemble it, I find the box is missing the part (Part A according to the instructions) that connects the handle to the rake. With out that particular part, it’s useless. I’m not giving one star for build quality, but for lack of quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: CHECK THE TAPERED ENDS
customer_reviews.text: Tapered ends (male end) need to be sanded with emery cloth to facilitate assembly and allow disassembly should the need arise. Everything else was clearly explained and all needed parts were provided. Arrived in great condition and with addition of that little bit of attention... great product sturdier and lighter weight than plastic rake. This is my 3rd rake in 20 years and 2nd one is at grand daughter's :-)
customer_reviews.author: L. White

customer_reviews.title: This works really well!
customer_reviews.text: Before buying this scraper, I borrowed a couple of different ones from a neighbor--one kinda like this one, and one with a long plastic sheet. The latter was interesting to use and was fairly effective (and fast, as promised) but it didn't clean close enough to the roof surface. This particular scraper works really well. It's lightweight, pretty sturdy, easy to assemble and dis-assemble. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: C & J

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed
customer_reviews.text: The assembly was easy (just get the support brackets oriented properly, as the more bent end attaches to the blade) and it works well. The 21ft model almost reaches the top of my cape cod house and I cleared the snow in a few minutes. The pole flexes quite a bit but that seems to help get over my gutter a little better. It is a decent workout, even for someone in their late 20s, but the price is good and it protects my shingles as I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Not just for snow
customer_reviews.text: I needed a sturdy long pole to remove old vines from a very tall tree. I knew that these kind of roof rakes are made to be pulled hard and would be perfect for this purpose. I did not need the 'shovel' part but threaded a large hook through the wholes instead. With the curved end sticking tight I was able to yank most of the vines off the tree. Adjusting the height with the extensions as needed. The quality of this shovel is excellent and I am sure it will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: NostalgicMom

customer_reviews.title: Essential!
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't I buy this last year?! Excellent. This roof rake is light, sturdy, and makes quick work of removing snow from my roof without damaging the shingles. My roof with its complicated lines and deep overhangs is great at making ice dams. This year It gets raked after every snow and no ice buildup. I bought the 16 ft version since I could buy an extra extension later if necessary (with no price penalty). It is plenty long enough for my tall steep roof. The rollers do not seem to roll very freely but I have not noticed any loss of granules from the shingles. Nevertheless, it would give me peace of mind if they rolled more easily.
customer_reviews.author: volbar

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Cleared three feet deep snow that had been rained on for two days and refrozen. It took some testing to find out how much to grab at a time, but the rake design supported over loading too large of a section. Now that we have this valued tool, I won’t let so much snow build up and there will be no reason to allow rain to complicate the snowpack. Also let me mention my surprise that this doesn’t drag on the roof (thanks to the rollers), so no damage it done to the roof.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great, Helped Save Roof
customer_reviews.text: I had massive ice dams and water coming in through my roof before purchasing this snow rake. Although it could'nt clear the ice that was already there, it helped prevent them from getting thicker and also allowed me to clear snow that would have melted and likely leaked into my home. Easy to assemble, light and strong, easy to use. I have no doubt this will let me easily clear my roof next year BEFORE ice dams build up.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Good lightweight roof rake
customer_reviews.text: It works great but is really just for new snow...it is very light weight which is good for use but the side braces bent when I tried to pull some more solid snow off the roof. The manufacturer should use solid rods for these braces. I bent them back by hand which tells you how thin they are. I also added rubber washers between the loc-nuts and the connection surface. This will reduce stainless(nuts) against aluminum wear.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Carter

customer_reviews.title: Saved my trailer roof
customer_reviews.text: I specifically bought this to remove snow from a utility trailer that was not built to handle much snow load. This worked well as long as I avoided any roof penetrations (roof vent) so I imagine it would work even better on a sloped roof with fewer obstructions. It has many sections so you can add more for higher/longer roofs but the more you add the harder it is to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie Monster

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: This was a lifesaver last winter when snow was piling on our roof from a very strong winter. It's tough to use after the snow has really settled for long. You need to get right in there while it's still light and fluffy and pull the snow off the roof. We bent it up pretty good trying to pull down heavy snow. It held up well though.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Lange

customer_reviews.title: Not the best.
customer_reviews.text: We needed this to get snow off the garage part of the house. It does the job with quite a bit of effort. Threw it out behind the shed during the winter as it is hard to dissemble the poles. We had no problems with the wheels on it, they attached and worked fine, the pole was a pain to put together and disassemble. Not great but when you have a foot of snow on the roof and you don't want your ridge beam to crack its worth getting.
customer_reviews.author: TLMKC

customer_reviews.title: Prevent Ice Dams
customer_reviews.text: Last winter we got hit with a lot of snow, more than I can remember. We have a tall house and a lot of people were getting leaks inside their homes due to ice dams forming. Once it arrived, I assembled within 10 minutes and it worked perfect—I was able to extend it very long and it cleared off snow without problem. You can disassemble it very easily. As a homeowner, and if you live in an environment where you can accumulate a lot of snow, it’s worth the investment versus having water leak inside your house.
customer_reviews.author: GreenBass

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived on time & when it was supposed to. I don’t know why another person complained the wheels were wrong- the wheels I got are correct, but you have to find where the wheel is spliced down the side to place it properly. I did not have any trouble putting it together and it worked well for it’s purpose. I don’t know how reliable it would be extended to full capacity since I have a ranch home & didn’t need it extended that far.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: this is a great snow rake
customer_reviews.text: this is a great snow rake. with all the handles attached, its a bit awkward to manuveur and slightly heavy (i am a 50 year old somewhat unfit woman) but i could still manage to get it on the roof and clean the snow. more difficult for me was the area in the back yard that has many electrical wires - since the handle is hard to continually remove and replace for different roof heights, i always leave them together and that makes it harder to control in tight areas. but i highly recommend this rake!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great if you never plan on disassembling it
customer_reviews.text: The rake works fine. Unfortunately whoever was in charge of compressing the tubing ends did a poor job and the four pieces that allegedly just click together will not come loose. I'd love to return this piece of garbage but I'll have to get my pipe cutter out to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Rhombus

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and not well built. Had higher expectations based on price.
customer_reviews.text: It’s very flimsy. I realize they need to keep weight down but a couple of ridges in the handles would keep it from flexing so much. The flexing in the handle makes it pretty hard to lift when the head of the rake is further away you. For the cost of the rake I would have expected a much better built product. However it did get the job done, so I will give it at least two stars.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Helped Clear Our Bedroom Roof
customer_reviews.text: My husband used this to clear some of the accumulated snow off our bedroom roof. We got it late in the season, but will start using it on the first snowfall next winter. To be honest, I found it difficult to use myself, so I'll leave it to my husband in the future. I would say that men are probably the best operators of this snow rake.
customer_reviews.author: Le H.

customer_reviews.title: Works great after repairs
customer_reviews.text: This broke the second time I used it. The nut came off one of the connections. I replaced it with a heavier duty one and tightened down all of the other nuts and bolts and since then it's worked fine. It does get unwieldy and flimsy when all of the poles are attached and if the snow is wet and heavy it's tough to pull on. You have to be patient and pull down a few inches at a time.
customer_reviews.author: the toy cannon

customer_reviews.title: I had one like this when we lived in WI
customer_reviews.text: I had one like this when we lived in WI, and it was great and came in handy. We moved to a Southern state and I gave it away when we moved. Since then we have since moved back to a Northern state with snow, and really wished I had it. Made it through the first winter, but purchased this in time for the 2nd winter. If you think you might need a snow rake, you really need to buy them in the off season, or you will never find one when and if you really need it.
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty tough
customer_reviews.text: Tested it on some frozen snow on my shed (Snow storm in UT had it delayed there so I actually paid a guy to bring his Garelick to remove snow from the house). I basically tried to abuse it to see how tough it was so it wouldn't let me down it a time of real need. It passed without any issues. The handle is flexible enough so that when you hook into some frozen snow or ice it will pop out after some serious yanking without bending the handles or the blade/scraper/rake. I would definitely buy another if something happened to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Well Built
customer_reviews.text: It hasn't snowed yet but the build quality is very good. I did make a rake attachment and used the handles to clear the leaves off my garage roof. I know this is going to work for clearing snow just fine. Garelick makes really good products and they are in St. Paul MN so you know they developed it to work good for snow.
customer_reviews.author: Grey Squrrel

customer_reviews.title: it works fine for fresh fallen snow
customer_reviews.text: Ditto on the holes not lining up ... had to get a neighbor with a drill bit for metal to fix the hole to attach handle to rake head. Other than that, it works fine for fresh fallen snow, however, if you let it pile up with layers of ice in between, it is a lot of work to hack through the ice layers. A rake head with a sharper edge would do better in that case, although you then risk damaging the shingles. But this one is good to have on hand if you can tackle each snowfall as it occurs and are just dealing with fresh, loose snow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time worrying about removing snow from a roof - so this is my first snow rake. It was easy enough to assemble except for the bolt with the uncut threads (QC problem?), and the wheel design makes we wonder if they really turn (see other ratings). Other than that, I managed to pull some snow off the roof so the rake works.
customer_reviews.author: Kauai Tom

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a lifesaver. I have an area on my roof where the snow accumulates in a valley and as it melts, it's leaks down onto my front door steps. As the water freezes again, my steps become slippery. By using this to take the snow off the roof, the problem disappears. Easy to use, but I recommend tightening the screws each time before using. I've already lost some and had to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Roof saver!
customer_reviews.text: After suffering leaks due to the heavy snowpack, I bought this item on Amazon after realizing that no retail stores like Home Depot were carrying it. Of course, they always claim that I can order it on their website, but I don't trust them. The product performs brilliantly. It's light in weight, yet durable. The inter-connecting poles make assemble easy, and I have had no problems with sections detaching. The rake does a good job of scraping snow off the roof. I am careful to rake slowly as I finish the last run to avoid digging into the shingles. There are small rubber attachments to the rake blade which also keep roof damage from occurring.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but sturdy.  Does the job.  Stay on the ground and stay SAFE.
customer_reviews.text: Add as many extensions as necessary. Easy to use. Use common sense when scraping your roof. Do no drop it on the roof, you could damage your roof by being careless. Careful around windows. Beyond 2 extensions, it can get a bit unwieldly. Reasonably priced. Used only 2X this year. Weather was different. Nasty ice dams in our gutters last year before I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY THE WORST PRODUCT. If you put it together it WILL NOT COME APART. DO NOT BUY- VERY POOR QUALITY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason P.

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't call it light weight
customer_reviews.text: I have seen a few reviews that indicate that it is light weight and easy to use. I would not say it is light weight. Granted I am a 54 year old woman, but this left me sweating and with my shoulders aching. I don't expect that any other one would be much lighter though, and it did the job. I will have to do it in stages - it wears me out.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Good tool- I lost 5 lbs. chasing the nuts and bolts, but I needed that anyway.
customer_reviews.text: It is a good tool and saves having to hire someone to get on your roof and shovel it off, but make sure you get some extra nuts and bolts!! The original ones kept falling off -- It's an easy fix, as long as you have quick access to a hardware store. It's easy to use. Better than having your roof cave in. Just got mine a few days ago and had to keep stopping and putting it back together and figure out where the nuts and bolts got to. It could maybe be standard with wingnuts or something that tights up better. Helpful item, though.
customer_reviews.author: independent

customer_reviews.title: Works Great if you can follow instructions
customer_reviews.text: Use as long as you don’t try to pull too much snow or over extend yourself. Unfortunately wife did not adhere to instructions and she over extended her reach with the roof rake. Consequently she fell off a 5 ft snow bank and incurred a displaced tibea plateau fracture. That set back my insurance company $35,000 (ambulance, ER, surgery, 3 days hospitalization, PT).
customer_reviews.author: Tall Guy

customer_reviews.title: Works Marginally Well and Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Works OK. Long handle is flimsy and the blade angle tends to make the rake dive into the snow/ice and gets stuck. While I didn't break the rake, I feel a hard tug would easily break it. I realize the designer is balancing weight and sturdiness but a larger diameter handle would provide a more rigid rake; especially when the extensions are used. I did a lot of deburring of sharp edges before assembling the rake. I have a dislike for sharp sheared sheet metal edges that can slice flesh.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Thomas

customer_reviews.title: a good choice
customer_reviews.text: pulls even heavy snow. i'm too old for roofing adventures. good product and good price.
customer_reviews.author: ex-truck driver

customer_reviews.title: Should be cheaper as quality is poor.
customer_reviews.text: Received today. Used it for approximately 2hrs. Metal blade has already bent a bit. Handle grip does not stay on. Easy to put together. Easy to take apart. Did a good job getting snow off of the roof. The way the handles connect however are very flimsy and it feels like they are going to snap at any moment. There were cheaper options for different styles and i went with this one because it was listed as a best seller by Amazon. Obviously that's just in reference to how many they sell not quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very effective and strong!
customer_reviews.text: This roof rake worked well in removing snow from my roof this winter. The rollers on the scraping edge kept it from damaging my asphalt shingles. The aluminum is strong and lightweight and didn't bend or distort the more sections I added for length. I bought this one after another cheaper product failed miserably. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This was the best purchase, No ice dams yeah
customer_reviews.text: Came just in time for big snow on the roof. The rollers keep it from damaging shingles. This was the best purchase, No ice dams yeah!! Now that temps are up the roof seems to be clearing faster with the melted water able to drain quicker into the gutter. You wont be sorry in buying this. The snow was heavy and it was effortless to clear the snow off the edges of the roof of my one story home. The handle extensions make it easy to reach the snow, its a sturdy product all aluminum but light enough to handle. Worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Minnie cat

customer_reviews.title: Pole not rigid enough
customer_reviews.text: The only problem with this roof rake is that the aluminum poles aren't rigid enough when fully extended. The pole bends and flexes and the rake end wobbles an flops making it hard to control. If the poles were more rigid this would be a great product. Assembly is simple and fast. If you don't need the full 20 feet and only use two or three of the pole sections it might be better, but I have a two story house and need the full extension.
customer_reviews.author: B. Staehle

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: my husband has a disability so its up to me to rake the roof. this one is really easy to use and handle. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ann nowak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! This is easy to assemble and store
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! This is easy to assemble and store. Handle segments click in and out with ease. Blade pulls snow off the roof at a steady and predictable rate. It is light and yet appears to be durable enough to last. I have used it on old snow, new snow and wind packed snow. Super please with this purchase and wondering why I didn't buy one years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Mtn Folks

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Has the reach and weight you need to quick and easy pull 3 ft of fairly wet snow off a good portion of roof. Rollers didn't damage ice melting wire runs clipped to shingles, and the blade is a good balance of bite and strength. Bit awkward with all four handle segments together for me, but then I'm 72. Reach with three segments deemed adequate for my needs with moderate snow..
customer_reviews.author: Dr John

customer_reviews.title: good enough I guess
customer_reviews.text: Once together it will do the job. I had to use a drill to widen the hold from the pole to the head. I also filed it a bit so that I wouldn't need to widen the hole too much. I haven't actually raked any snow yet, but I can't imagine why it won't work. The instructions say to soak some parts in water before installing them. Yah, thats not going to happen. But I should have for the hand grip. It went on half way and now it isn't moving.. oh well.
customer_reviews.author: D.Ayotte

customer_reviews.title: Get one
customer_reviews.text: Now that winter is over and I could see my roof again, I can attest that the rake did zero damage to my shingles. This rake is super long allowing me to reach about 90% of my roof from the driveway. My house is a ranch with a slightly over-sized roof, so I was very impressed with the reach of this rake. It works as advertised and I honestly am not sure how I got through previous winters without a roof rake. I tried the pucks that supposedly melt snow and prevent ice damming. That idea did not work and actually caused more ice around the gutters. The roof rake is simple, works, and prevents ice around my gutters.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good product -  worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Used it on a recent 12" snow fall & this pulled the snow off 4' from the edges of the roof, and I still had one more section of handle I didn't even put on. Light weight but sturdy. This area would ice up after a heavy snow fall , but after pulling the snow off, the ice never built up. Wish I bought one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: tmm570

customer_reviews.title: Good roof rake, easy to use and does what it is supposed to do!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great snow roof rake. In 2016-2017 we got hit hard with snow and ice dams...the worst happened while we were away. We never had a need for one of these, but quickly purchased one to get the snow off the roof and reduce the possibility of the ice dams from forming. It worked great last year...this year 2017-2018 we haven't had much snow, which is more typical. But we have the rake for when we do!
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: The aluminum face and wheels make this rake sweet, my other plastic face rake is broken on ...
customer_reviews.text: The aluminum face and wheels make this rake sweet, my other plastic face rake is broken on one side and it is hanging in the garage waiting to be repaired should I decide to even go down that path. Now to be fair I have to say that I never made contact with the company that made the plastic face rake so I do not know what they would do for me but I still have to look at the fact that the plastic face has no means to keep it off the shingles and to be fair there is a considerable price difference between the two rakes. Your call on which one fits your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Timmy K

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, excellent functioning
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was a breeze (I did soak the plastic wheels in hot water for 5 minutes as advised by other reviewers). The unit is a good balance between being light weight for easy handling, but strong enough to stand the stress of working it. Used it on three homes same day delivered and assembled. I definitely recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Needed and Does the Trick
customer_reviews.text: I live in Michigan, right now it's -6 outside (Jan 30th, 2019) in the Detroit area. Many of the homes around me have ice sickles hanging from them. I haven't one. It's a good rake, it's light enough that even an old guy like me can get the job done and do it fast. Yep, if you're thinking about it - get it! You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Guitar Man

customer_reviews.title: Fairly easy assembly, works pretty good
customer_reviews.text: The only challenge was getting the wheels on. I did most of the snow removal with only 3 tube sections. It bends too much with all 4 sections. I was impressed with ease of snow removal. Fairly light weight. Easy does it. Start with only a few feet into roof edge. Don't try to scrape 8 feet at once, especially if the snow is deep.
customer_reviews.author: dixiedreg

customer_reviews.title: I like the light weight and the length even though I ...
customer_reviews.text: 2-9-17 Used it for the first time. Removed about 8 inches of snow, about 6 feet up the roof. I like the light weight and the length even though I didn't use all the extensions. I think because of the light weight I will have to be gentle with it when using it. The poles feel like they could bend easily if I whip it when moving it to another section of roof. I would recommend this product because of the light weight and easy to maneuver from section to section with the caution of taking your time.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Moved to northern Michigan and had no idea what winters were like. Snow build up on the roof is scary. Everyone seems to use these rakes to clear the snow. This one works fine. If I just need to get drifts off the edge, I can leave out one section of the (4 section) handle for easier manuverablility. Only used one winter but seems to be sturdy and looks like it will last a while with normal use. (Also attached window squeege to long handle to reach very high windows. )
customer_reviews.author: mojo716

customer_reviews.title: NOT ALL ALUMINUM
customer_reviews.text: I just received this rake. In the description they say this is an all aluminum rake. The nuts, bolts, and buttons are not aluminum or stainless steel and will rust. This makes a big difference if you want to store it outside in the winter and is not consistent with their description as an "all aluminum" rake. For the price you would expect all pieces to be rust proof.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight snow rake!
customer_reviews.text: Hated the instructions that came with this, but I figured it out in a relatively short period of time. Awesome length and love the light weight. Does a great job of clearing the piles of snow that form at the base of the solar panels on my garage when the snow slides down the panels. I can easily reach the apron under the panels and pull the snow off of the roof to allow more to slide off of the panels to keep them cleared and generating. Works surprisingly well. I recommend this wholeheartedly.
customer_reviews.author: K. Milne

customer_reviews.title: Broke the 3rd time using it
customer_reviews.text: Winters in Wyoming are big. Had tried a few roof rakes. This had good reviews, so I bought it. But, it broke while using it for only the 3rd time. You will see in the pics the 2 places it broke. In the middle pic, the metal is actually pealing away. In the 3rd pic, the left metal arm snapped in half. I was surprised at the weakness of the metal. Anyone else have this problem?
customer_reviews.author: E. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Its a back saver!
customer_reviews.text: I used this today. Did Lots of my raking of my roof. I had all 4 sections going at some points. I like that it is light weight amd hopping it to anotjer spot does mot tale much effort. It seems to get down to the shingles but does not appear to damage them, thanks to the two wheels. For short reaches using just 2 or 3 sectiona, this thing is a dream. At 4 sections (21 feet), it was less perfect, but totally usable. By far and away the best roof rake Ive ever used, for the length it comes in. Im not sure how it would be beyond 21 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Best winter tool!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. We did put the rollers in a cup of hot water then gently ran CLOSED scissors down them to expand the gap and they went on like a dream. So much better than getting up on the roof. A must if you get even one big snow a year. Even fun to use. Be sure to use it as soon as possible after the snow--it comes off much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Huntley

customer_reviews.title: Well Made and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. The snap in pole extensions are the only way to go rather than those twist-lock kind and why I chose this rake, plus shovel is metal not plastic for longevity. Wheels on bottom save the roof tiles (important!). Only four stars being no assembly instructions were included. Luckily, I bought the brush attachment by Garelick separately for my solar panels and it had instructions for both brush and rake, which included a great tip on how to get the rake wheels on blade. Happy with my choice and made in the USA is a big plus in my book.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It helped me keep most of the snow off the bad spots where ice built up due to how the ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had to use this product less, but we had a weird winter one year and this was cheaper than adding heating tape at the time. It helped me keep most of the snow off the bad spots where ice built up due to how the sun hits my roof. I thought it worked well for what it was. It wasn't the easiest to use due to the length of the pole needed, but I can't think of a better way to do it. And it moved well on the roof to pull off the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Risley

customer_reviews.title: BIG THUMBS UP for design & ease of use!
customer_reviews.text: Waited to report till after 3 snowfalls. Worked great on slushy, heavy 4 inch snow on roof and porches - must have taken over 500lbs off the roof alone. The wheels at the bottom of the blade protect the shingles as the roll freely while you pull the blade towards you. This past Nor'easter was quick and easy in PA - now my roofs are dried off from the sunshine and look less burdened than most of my neighbors. Each use gets easier and faster to accomplish with the full 21 foot extensions in place. This is a superior product compared to the other mfg. models I've seen on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: GardenWithGenerosityi2020

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Assembly is easy. Definitely need to first heat water and 'soak' the plastic blade rollers/shingle protectors to get them on easily. The system is light weight and sturdy. I used a max of 3 poles on my one story home pulling down 18" snow. 4th pole might be needed for 2 story roof, but the total length of the system makes for awkward handling, especially in constricted areas. Takes about 2 minutes to figure out the technique.
customer_reviews.author: White Marlin

customer_reviews.title: Complete junk! Stay away from this product!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a piece of crap, If I could get it no stars I would. It’s cheap aluminum that bends and has no structure to it at all, the wheels don’t spin, and the screws will just come out of it. Save your money and stay away! Garelick should be refunding everyone back their money that bought this crap and they should be ran out of town!
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: the best long rake, as the wheels help keep you from hurting the roof
customer_reviews.text: This rake is great. Above my stoop, I need to rake as much of the roof as possible in order to prevent ice on my front steps. Without the wheels on this rake, I'm afraid that I would have gouged the higher parts of the roof, as this long rake is heavier than the ones with plastic blades, but the wheels make that far less likely and help me clear off the maximum snow from that area. I use it on other parts of my roof as well, but just rake away the bottom 3 feet or so, I have used it for two seasons and cannot imagine using any other rake.
customer_reviews.author: M. Collins

customer_reviews.title: LIfe saver!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. It's awkward to use because of the length but it works. We had really bad ice dams so it was difficulty to maneuver over the dams. When it's just snow, it pulls the snow off easily. Be prepared for a work out! My arms were toast after 20 minutes. My roof does not have a steep pitch so that's probably why it was hard to drag off. When I helped my neighbor who has a pitched roof and it was much easier. I was a little concerned about the rake part when I was pulling the snow over the ice dams because it would look like it was going to pop off. Held up well though.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Works very well. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. 21 foot length reached almost the entire front of our split-level house, and about 1/2 way up in back. I had to stand on 6 foot step ladder to achieve these results. Construction is good. It gets hard to manage when the full length is extended. Rollers are good to protect the roof. Gripper handle sometimes fell off so beware if you're holding just that. Has stood up to this winter in Boston area, which is 6 inches away from being the snowiest year ever here. Easy to store. Keep the box to put the disassembled rods in. Good product. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made product and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very durable when using for raking snow off of roofs. The only issue I had was that it was very difficult to break apart when it was cold, but I think that spraying some lubricant in the joints would help with that. I'm assuming it has something to do with the aluminum contracting with the cold and causing tightness in the assembly joints. High quality materials, should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Compton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: With all the snow we've had this year, finding these things locally is near impossible. This one arrived sooner than I expected, was easy to put together, and is better quality than my last one though similarly priced. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Magikarp Salad

customer_reviews.title: snow rake
customer_reviews.text: Borrowed this from a neighbor who kindly offered it's use last winter to clear my elderly father's roof. It worked great! I went home and ordered one for my dad and for ourselves. Lightweight and easy to use. Really clears the roof well.
customer_reviews.author: F. Gast

customer_reviews.title: Great snow rake. Did the trick for me.
customer_reviews.text: Boy did this work great, I purchased this for my 2 story roof at the end of the season. But then a ton of snow hit us again so I was happy to use this. I cleared the roof over my front steps, deck and anywhere I thought necessary. Very easy assembly When I was finished I easily took it apart for storing on a shelf in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie ATop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done!
customer_reviews.text: After a hard winter in 2014 and having to borrow someone else's roof rake, we finally took the plunge and invested in our own. It went together easily and worked as promised. Although I've only used it twice, it was flexible, yet not overly flexible, to allow me to clear snow several feet up on our two story roof. My only suggestion is to not do what I did and wait to assemble it when it is already extremely cold outside and snow is waiting to be raked...brrrr!
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality product. We had record amounts of snowfall here in Utah this year. I wished I had ordered it sooner. At one point we had about 2.5' of snow on our roof and I was getting concerned. By the time I ordered it we started to get rain and much of the snow was melting away. We used it a little bit but didn't get to use it as much as I would have liked. This is a pretty well built implement and for what little we used it, it seemed to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: scburg66

customer_reviews.title: It does work well
customer_reviews.text: Edges should be polished better. It would be easy to slice your hand or finger installing roller roof guides. Nice lightweight unit and easy to add sections on but in time I will probably bolt sections together if push button releases break .
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Raking isn't just for fall
customer_reviews.text: Ice damming is a serious concern for me in winter, especially because ice tends to build up on top of my gutter guards. Removing snow from my roof using this rake helps to prevent ice buildup, especially over the front door where ice tends to form fastest. It has small plastic wheels that help it roll along the roof, saving your shingles from direct scraping. The long handle exists in four segments, which can be difficult to add or remove in the cold.
customer_reviews.author: McGibblets

customer_reviews.title: Wheels don’t turn but do the job protecting the shingles.
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. Took all of 5 minutes. Works good to get the snow off of my roof. The wheels do there job but are more of a skid than a wheel. And if you don’t land the rake perfectly horizontally on the roof, the corners can hit your shingles.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Helgeson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price....in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: Got this to clear out snow on the roof....worked as advertised. Nothing broken or bent. Someone from local was selling a 16 footer for 10 dollars, and I snagged it. So combined, I got 37 feet long, which I don't think I will do because it might break. I did use 26' without issue.
customer_reviews.author: MDJ

customer_reviews.title: Upper body workout but safe
customer_reviews.text: This item worked for my purposes. I ordered this in 16 ft length and it was long enough to get 98% to the top of my 1 story ranch home. It got 100% of my separate garage building. Now I ordered the brush/ broom and am waiting for that to arrive because I got this for leaves not snow, seeing that I'm in the south. The construction was good enough for price. I will say that you will get an upper body workout but at least it's safer than falling off the roof.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lovett

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding snow tool
customer_reviews.text: There were several choices of roof rakes and I am so glad that I chose this one. It arrives quickly, assembly was easy and it does an outstanding job pushing or pulling snow off of the roof. While there are 4 sections, I found I only needed to use 2 for my purpose. I also purchased one for a critical friend of mine, and he was also thrilled with the product. Highly recommended!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: works well, but...
customer_reviews.text: The durability of this rake is very good. The big problem that we encountered was when assembling. The directions were straight-forward but some of the poles were not exactly round at the points where the additions would be attached. My husband has to hammer the openings to make the extensions fit. Not good! The only advantage I can imagine is that during this hard winter, it did mean that each section was nearly impossible to remove from each other, so from a safety standpoint, that is great. However, when trying to assemble initially, not so great. All being said though, we are glad we purchased this over others with plastic components which would have broken immediately upon use.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

product_meta.title: Garelick 89421 21-Foot Aluminum Snow Roof Rake With 24-Inch Blade
product_meta.description:
Size:21'Safely remove snow from roofs and help prevent ice dams. Ice dams cause water to back up under shingles, ruining roofs, ceilings and walls. Removing snow also relieves unnecessary weight on the roof which can damage the eaves.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
By far the best roof rake on the market with its exclusive, patented "Shingle Saver" rollers. This unique snow flake roller design is easier to use because the blade never touches the roof's surface, preventing damage while making it easier to roll back up the roof. By using the Garelick 89421 21-foot Snow Roof Rake to safely remove snow from roofs, homeowners can prevent the damage of much-publicized ice dams. Ice dams cause water to back up under shingles, ruining roofs, ceilings and walls. Removing snow also relieves unnecessary weight on the roof which can damage the eaves.
feature_bullets: Patented shingle saver rollers make the rake easy to use
Blade never touches the roof's surface
Prevents damage while making it easier to roll back up the roof
Marine product quality and innovation for over 60-years

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,135 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
